page.title: 10INDUSTRY IN WALKDEN
page.content: INDUSTRY IN WALKDEN In Walkden there are two types of main industry in our history.We had the mills and the collieries.The mills were built around 1860 by the men of the Walkden and Little Hulton region. The mills had names like Park Mill, Boat Shed Mill and Primrose Mill. Reservoirs were built near the mills so that they had plenty of water to run the machines.The mills were used for making cotton.However,during a recession,mills closed.Now the old mills have been made into warehouses. Walkden also had a colliery.The seam became known as the Walkden 4 foot wide.In between the layers of coal were layers of shale,sandstone and other minerals.The seam ran to Walkden Town Hall.It was owned by the Nightingale family.There was a mine where Mesne Lea Primary School now is.
